{"step_by_step_thinking": "First permanent molars, also known as '6-year molars' because they usually erupt around the age of 6, begin to calcify before birth. They do not start calcifying at birth or 1 year after birth. They also start calcifying before the deciduous incisors, which are the first set of teeth that appear in a child's mouth.", "answer_choice": "A. 6 months of intra uterine life"}
